info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 12 at 8:49PM CDT until July 12 at 11:45PM CDT by NWS St Louis MO
info.description:
FFWLSX
The National Weather Service in St Louis has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... East Central Reynolds County in southeastern Missouri...
* Until 1145 PM CDT.
* At 849 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. This includes a small portion of the Black river near Highway K.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mainly rural areas of East Central Reynolds County. Black River near Highway K.
info.instruction:
Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
